rules: Rule1: If a disease causes effects on animals, then animals become infected with that disease.
Rule2: Whenever electronic devices report to publications, legislation becomes compliant with electronic devices.
Rule3: Either animals violate legislation or, if electronic devices alert about animals, then electronic devices report to publications.

Rule4: Either publication studies diseases or, if the implication that regulation of electronic devices by legislation not causing disease in animals implies that legislation requires publication, then legislation does not approve electronic devices, which in turn implies that legislation does not exempt electronic devices.
Rule5: Provided that disease spreads among animals, animals do not become infected with disease.
Rule6: Whenever electronic devices identify diseases, then if disease causes effects on animals, disease spreads among animals.
Rule7: Electronic devices identify diseases or electronic devices analyze diseases.
Rule8: If publication describes diseases, then publication documents information about animals.
Rule9: Provided that publication explains diseases, publication documents information about animals.
Rule10: Whenever publication reviews diseases, then either publication describes diseases or publication explains diseases.
Rule11: Under the condition that publication summarizes diseases, then either publication describes diseases or publication explains diseases.

Rule12: If publication documents information about animals, then if the implication that regulation of electronic devices by legislation not causing disease in animals implies that legislation requires publication, then legislation does not approve electronic devices.
Rule13: If electronic devices monitor diseases, then electronic devices alert about animals.
Rule14: Electronic devices monitor diseases or electronic devices detect diseases.
Rule15: Whenever electronic devices detect diseases, legislation is compliant with electronic devices.
Rule16: If it is not the case that studying diseases by publication leads to recommending legislation by publication, then legislation amends electronic device regulations.
Rule17: Provided that it is not the case that either legislation bans electronic devices or legislation does not amend electronic device regulations, then animals challenge legislation.

Rule18: If it is not the case that analyzing diseases by electronic devices implies that if disease causes effects on animals then disease spreads among animals, then animals do not conflict with legislation.
Rule19: Provided that it is not the case that either publication reviews diseases or publication summarizes diseases, then publication disputes legislation.
Rule20: Whenever it is not the case that either publication reviews diseases or publication summarizes diseases, then publication does not dispute legislation.

Rule21: Under the condition that it is not the case that the non-occurrence of either banning electronic devices by legislation or not amending electronic device regulations by legislation implies animals do not challenge legislation, then legislation enforces publication requirements.

Rule22: If it is not the case that the implication that regulation of electronic devices by legislation not causing disease in animals implies that legislation requires publication, then legislation approves electronic devices.

Rule23: Whenever it is not the case that the non-occurrence of either analyzing diseases by electronic devices implying that if disease causes effects on animals then disease spreads among animals, or animals conflicting with legislation, then legislation resolves publication issues.

Rule24: Under the condition that it is not the case that the implication that the non-occurrence of either regulation of electronic devices by legislation not causing disease in animals implying legislation requires publication, or legislation not approving electronic devices, then legislation exempts electronic devices.
Rule25: Provided that publication does not document information about animals, publication cites legislation.
Rule26: Whenever legislation is not compliant with electronic devices, disease causes effects on animals.
facts: Fact2: Animals do not violate legislation.
Fact3: Publication does not recommend legislation.
Fact4: Legislation does not ban electronic devices.
Fact5: Legislation does not enforce publication requirements.
Fact6: Legislation does not resolve publication issues.
Fact7: Legislation does not require publication.
Fact8: Publication does not cite legislation.

question: Legislation is compliant with electronic devices.
